A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Complete and utter garbage. It’s not Rian Johnson’s fault that nearly every new(ish) character not named Rey is boring at best or that Luke Skywalker remains as annoying three decades later as he was in the original trilogy. I’m going to lay the ridiculously cheesy dialog and the just plain stupid plot at his feet though. Add to that overzealous onslaught of Jar Jar Binks caliber levity and a run time that’s a solid sixty minutes too long\, and The Last Jedi is so atrocious that I actually found myself hoping that the rebellion would in fact be destroyed\, the series mercifully ended and the audience put out of our collective misery. It’s not the worst installment in the series (that distinction still belongs to The Phantom Menace)\, but Johnson’s childhood destroying abomination comes in a close second. My five year old couldn’t wait to go home and my sixteen year old called it “one of the most disappointing experiences of his life”\, proving that you didn’t have to be as emotionally invested in this story as I was to be completely let down by this film.
